abstract.text: Overridden by subclasses to adjust page width during automatic pagination.

inlineContent.text: Returns by indirection a new
value for the right edge of the pending page rectangle in the view’s coordinate system.
A
value that sets the left edge of the pending page rectangle in the view’s coordinate system.
A
value that sets the right edge of the pending page rectangle in the view’s coordinate system.
The leftmost
value
can be set to, as calculated using the value of the
property.
This method is invoked by
. The view can pull in the right edge and return the new value in
, allowing it to prevent items such as small images or text columns from being divided across pages. If
is exceeded, the pagination mechanism simply uses
for the right edge.
The default implementation of this method propagates the message to its subviews, allowing nested views to adjust page width for their drawing as well. An
object or other small view, for example, will nudge the right edge out if necessary to prevent itself from being cut in two (thereby pushing it onto an adjacent page). Subclasses should invoke
’s implementation, if desired, after first making their own adjustments.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A control that defines an area on the screen that a user clicks to trigger an action.
The infrastructure for drawing, printing, and handling events in an app.
Overridden by subclasses to adjust page height during automatic pagination.
Overridden by subclasses to adjust page width during automatic pagination.
The fraction of the page that can be pushed onto the next page during automatic pagination to prevent items such as lines of text from being divided across pages.
Returns
if the view handles page boundaries,
otherwise.
Invoked by
to determine the location of the region of the view being printed on the physical page.
This action method opens the Print panel, and if the user chooses an option other than canceling, prints the view and all its subviews to the device specified in the Print panel.
Implemented by subclasses to determine the portion of the view to be printed for the specified page number.
The fraction of the page that can be pushed onto the next page during automatic pagination to prevent items such as small images or text columns from being divided across pages.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
A false value.
A true value.
The basic type for all floating-point values.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
